item.title: [AllStar] Lamps - EXP Rewards
item.dc:creator: @Kamran1 Kamran1
item.description:
@Kamran1 wrote:

Ahh I can’t be bothered, either use it or don’t use it…
Its your choice, I didn’t make this so everyone can rant about it.
I made this to help SOME people.
If people want to use Skully’s, feel free, not like I’m gonna stop someone from using it :\ …
I’m giving people some help if they would like lamps in their allstar. I didn’t say its perfect or anything.
People can use this tutorial at their own risk, yes you can spam click it, but I’m not gonna spoonfeed every part of lamps. Thats why people need to learn to code. If people want to learn feel free to inbox me and I’ll teach you how to make it require a lamp so people cannot spam click it.

Teach NOT Spoon feed.

item.title: [AllStar] Lamps - EXP Rewards
item.dc:creator: @Kamran1 Kamran1
item.description:
@Kamran1 wrote:

[quote=“Scully, post:21, topic:443709”]Yeah, no… this really isn’t even…
Keep in mind the interfaces are 400+, you’d have to add in the 317 ones.

[code=java]package runescape.content;

import runescape.content.interfaces.ButtonHandler;
import runescape.content.interfaces.ItemOptionHandler;
import runescape.model.Item;
import runescape.model.Skills;
import runescape.model.player.Player;

/*

  • This whole thing could probably be reworked to work for every lamp.
  • Make into an interface Event
  • Finish this the correct way with interfaces. IE: The interface at the end for telling you how much xp you’ve received instead of sending a message.
    */

public class GenieLamp extends Content implements ItemOptionHandler, ButtonHandler {

private static final int[] GENIE_LAMP_SKILL_IDS = { 
	Skills.ATTACK, Skills.STRENGTH, Skills.RANGE, Skills.MAGIC, Skills.DEFENCE,
	Skills.HITPOINTS, Skills.PRAYER, Skills.AGILITY, Skills.HERBLORE,
	Skills.THIEVING, Skills.CRAFTING, Skills.RUNECRAFTING, Skills.MINING,
	Skills.SMITHING, Skills.FISHING, Skills.COOKING, Skills.FIREMAKING,
	Skills.WOODCUTTING,	Skills.FLETCHING, Skills.SLAYER, Skills.FARMING, 
	Skills.CONSTRUCTION 
};

private static int genieLampIndex = -1;

public void setGenieLampIndex(int genieLampIndex) {
	this.genieLampIndex = genieLampIndex;
}

public int getGenieLampIndex() {
	return genieLampIndex;
}

@Override
public boolean handleButton(Player player, int interfaceId, int buttonId, int buttonId2) {
	if (interfaceId == 134) {			
		if (buttonId == 26) {
			if (getGenieLampIndex() == -1) {
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You must first select a skill before confirming your wish.");
			}				
			final int skillId = GENIE_LAMP_SKILL_IDS[getGenieLampIndex()];
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("The lamp grants you " + 10 * player.getSkills().getLevel(skillId) +" "+ Skills.SKILL_NAME[skillId] +" XP!");
			player.getSkills().addExperience(skillId, 10 * player.getSkills().getLevel(skillId));
			player.getInventory().remove(new Item(2528, 1));
			player.getInventory().refresh(player);
			player.getActionSender().sendCloseInterface();
			player.getActionSender().sendConfig(261, 0);
			setGenieLampIndex(-1);
		} else {
			setGenieLampIndex(buttonId - 4);
			player.getActionSender().sendConfig(261, buttonId - 3);			
		}
	}
	return false;
}

@Override
public boolean handleItemOption(Player player, int interfaceId, int index, int itemId) {
	if (interfaceId == 149 && itemId == 2528) {
		player.getActionSender().sendInterface(134);			
	}
	return false;
}

@Override
public Object getObject() {
	return this;
}

}
[/code][/quote]

It is an allstar… Most allstar based servers has 400+ interfaces. But Good Job anyway. + I didn’t really understand what you meant by “Yeah, no… this really isn’t even…”

Yours may be a bit complicated though, some people prefer not to make any more class files, they prefer to just put it into client.class. This tutorial only has 2 steps really, which both involve client.java and not much experience in coding and an allstar based server. Therefore I believe my tutorial is suitable for people who would like an allstar lamp system.

Read full topic

item.title: [AllStar] Lamps - EXP Rewards
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Yeah, no… this really isn’t even…
Keep in mind the interfaces are 400+, you’d have to add in the 317 ones.

[code=java]package runescape.content;

import runescape.content.interfaces.ButtonHandler;
import runescape.content.interfaces.ItemOptionHandler;
import runescape.model.Item;
import runescape.model.Skills;
import runescape.model.player.Player;

/*

  • This whole thing could probably be reworked to work for every lamp.
  • Make into an interface Event
  • Finish this the correct way with interfaces. IE: The interface at the end for telling you how much xp you’ve received instead of sending a message.
    */

public class GenieLamp extends Content implements ItemOptionHandler, ButtonHandler {

private static final int[] GENIE_LAMP_SKILL_IDS = { 
	Skills.ATTACK, Skills.STRENGTH, Skills.RANGE, Skills.MAGIC, Skills.DEFENCE,
	Skills.HITPOINTS, Skills.PRAYER, Skills.AGILITY, Skills.HERBLORE,
	Skills.THIEVING, Skills.CRAFTING, Skills.RUNECRAFTING, Skills.MINING,
	Skills.SMITHING, Skills.FISHING, Skills.COOKING, Skills.FIREMAKING,
	Skills.WOODCUTTING,	Skills.FLETCHING, Skills.SLAYER, Skills.FARMING, 
	Skills.CONSTRUCTION 
};

private static int genieLampIndex = -1;

public void setGenieLampIndex(int genieLampIndex) {
	this.genieLampIndex = genieLampIndex;
}

public int getGenieLampIndex() {
	return genieLampIndex;
}

@Override
public boolean handleButton(Player player, int interfaceId, int buttonId, int buttonId2) {
	if (interfaceId == 134) {			
		if (buttonId == 26) {
			if (getGenieLampIndex() == -1) {
				player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You must first select a skill before confirming your wish.");
			}				
			final int skillId = GENIE_LAMP_SKILL_IDS[getGenieLampIndex()];
			player.getActionSender().sendMessage("The lamp grants you " + 10 * player.getSkills().getLevel(skillId) +" "+ Skills.SKILL_NAME[skillId] +" XP!");
			player.getSkills().addExperience(skillId, 10 * player.getSkills().getLevel(skillId));
			player.getInventory().remove(new Item(2528, 1));
			player.getInventory().refresh(player);
			player.getActionSender().sendCloseInterface();
			player.getActionSender().sendConfig(261, 0);
			setGenieLampIndex(-1);
		} else {
			setGenieLampIndex(buttonId - 4);
			player.getActionSender().sendConfig(261, buttonId - 3);			
		}
	}
	return false;
}

@Override
public boolean handleItemOption(Player player, int interfaceId, int index, int itemId) {
	if (interfaceId == 149 && itemId == 2528) {
		player.getActionSender().sendInterface(134);			
	}
	return false;
}

@Override
public Object getObject() {
	return this;
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [AllStar] Lamps - EXP Rewards
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“Kamran1, post:12, topic:443709”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=546385.msg4007804#msg4007804 date=1338843098]
Code has a select all feature, quote doesn’t. Plus it’s looks nicer in [ code ]

public class newClass { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("This is a test"); } }

[quote]public class newClass {
public static void main(String[] args) {
System.out.println(“This is a test”);
}
}[/quote]
[/quote]

Please try pasting [ code ] into a notepad, tell me if it is jumbled or not, you’ll know what I mean if you try it.
Then try pasting the [ quote ] into a notepad, it will not be jumbled.

You’ll realise the difference and like [ quote ] better.[/quote]
They both come out the same way on mine.

Read full topic

public class newClass { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("This is a test"); } }

[quote]public class newClass {
public static void main(String[] args) {
System.out.println(“This is a test”);
}
}[/quote][/quote]

Please try pasting [ code ] into a notepad, tell me if it is jumbled or not, you’ll know what I mean if you try it.
Then try pasting the [ quote ] into a notepad, it will not be jumbled.

You’ll realise the difference and like [ quote ] better.

item.title: [AllStar] Lamps - EXP Rewards
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“Kamran1, post:10, topic:443709”]I myself hate the [ code ] for copy and pasting things into your server as it is not organised when you paste it for example;

Hello
My name is Kamran
This is MoparScape Forums

Paste that into a notepad, see how it turns out, its all jumbled.

With [ quote ] its not jumbled…

Hello
My name is Kamran
This is MoparScape Forums

Try it… Not jumbled at all. That is why I like [ Quote ] rather than [ Code ]…[/quote]
Code has a select all feature, quote doesn’t. Plus it’s looks nicer in [ code ]

public class newClass { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("This is a test"); } }

public class newClass { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("This is a test"); } }

Read full topic
